intro: Cullumia setosa var. adnata, commonly known as the slender cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
